evidence.text:
Person B: Have you spoken to Allie?
Person A: We’re still on a break. I’m trying to give her a little space... And just not really sure what my selling points are at the moment.
Person B: Psh! You’re a wonderful grandson. You know computers. You have your hair.
Person A: I think it’s gonna start to go early.
Person B: You can’t get hung up on that.
Person A: We’re just in different places... as people, you know? She’s thinks I’m stuck.
Person B: You’re too young to be stuck.

Person B: He was going on and on about how you hit someone and it’s worse than you think - she’s pregnant! And--
Person A: Oh, yes, that makes more sense.

Person A: I’ll call you tomorrow. You sure I can’t stay over?
Person A: For my mental health?

Person A: Your daughter.
Person B: Nice try. This is your father’s influence. There’s coins everywhere. They fall out of his pockets because he’s got no waist. Every time I ride with him I make five bucks. What’s this?
Person A: Grandma?! Oh my god! Are you alright?! WHAT THE FUCK IS HAPPENING?! SORRY! Are you okay?!
Person A: It’s an ad. You need to find the x.
Person A: It’s not always red. Sometimes they hide it. Look closer.
Person A: ...Are you talking to me?
Person B: I’m asking the machine.
Person A: She’s not there. Just in your phone. And you don’t need her￾

Person A: Hit enter. Thelma runs her fingers over the keys, finds it, and clicks.
Person B: What’s the password?
Person B: The password... is “password.” Harvey scoffs and rolls his eyes.

Person A: Classic. Now click inside of that box and type it in. She begins to enter it.
Person B: That’s cute.

Person B: Im assuming it was you on the phone pretending to be Danny. He doesn’t have the range. I’m not your grandma.
Person B: He called you a dumbass. He said it quietly but I heard it.
Person A: ...Oh, Danny, you remember Ben?

Person A: We got it.
Person B: Hi, Ben. Sorry, yes nice to see you.

Person A: Break a leg, Ben!
Person B: I’m not sure. He’s new to the theater. And his hip is titanium.

Person B: I love you. And if you ever do die, I’m really going to miss you. I know you know that. But I just wanted to say it. While we’re here.
Person A: Wherever I go, I won’t worry about you. You’re gonna be okay, Danny.
